text.content: For weekend of July 8th/9th: Need to finalize the sheets to add a Bounty Template. (This template won't be hard set, but will allow for adjustments of future Bounties dependent on: project size and thus $HUE quantity, contributor % breakdowns, and individual contributor usdc/hue breakdowns [for if required]. This template could then be dynamically adjusted to add more/less contributors with various usdc/hue ratios.) For the FTC Sheets, I also have some editing to do to make them “prettier” perse. This way, when we choose to hard vote on a distro model, we’ll be able to see it visually instead of all in pure table format. *

rich_text.plain_text: For weekend of July 8th/9th: Need to finalize the sheets to add a Bounty Template. (This template won't be hard set, but will allow for adjustments of future Bounties dependent on: project size and thus $HUE quantity, contributor % breakdowns, and individual contributor usdc/hue breakdowns [for if required]. This template could then be dynamically adjusted to add more/less contributors with various usdc/hue ratios.) For the FTC Sheets, I also have some editing to do to make them “prettier” perse. This way, when we choose to hard vote on a distro model, we’ll be able to see it visually instead of all in pure table format. *
NOTE

text.content: * I’m not sure if a vote for the FTC 36-months-timeline or the 68-months-variant (with 90% emitted over 36 months) is do-able prior to fcXP, but, that vote would make the distro longer. I can't imagine it would be an issue, but I want to clarify. *

rich_text.plain_text: * I’m not sure if a vote for the FTC 36-months-timeline or the 68-months-variant (with 90% emitted over 36 months) is do-able prior to fcXP, but, that vote would make the distro longer. I can't imagine it would be an issue, but I want to clarify. *
NOTE

text.content: -2* IIRC from the meeting today (7/5/23), Sarah is in the midst of creating the fcXP token, after which we can use such tokens to actually make the Bounty vote. Until then, I think we all agreed wholeheartedly with Jack that this vote shouldn't occur for Bounties Distro until financial contributors can also vote.

title.plain_text: Player movement at small controller input

text.content: Should we add a minimum input needed for movement? Any input value triggers movement currently. This allows the player to move at extremely slow speeds. This is typically set at the speed that would align with the base walking animation. Odyssey and spyro both appear to require a certain amount of input to move (spyro a bit more needed because of his faster movement)

text.content: Implement package for making Puzzle requests to Substratum

title.plain_text: Implement package for making Puzzle requests to Substratum

text.content: Create a new package for making requests to the Substratum service to perform CRUD operations on Puzzles. The package should include functionality for all the "puzzle" endpoints defined in the documentation here: https://staging.substratum.bloomstudio.gg/swagger/index.html That is: \`GET /puzzles\` - Return a list of all puzzles in the Bloom ecosystem \`POST /puzzles\` - Create a new puzzle \`GET /puzzles/{id}\` - Return a specific puzzle by its ID \`PATCH /puzzles/{id}\` - Delete an existing puzzle by its ID \`DELETE /puzzles/{id}\` - Update an existing puzzle by its ID If https://github.com/BloomGameStudio/BloomGameClient/issues/350 was completed first, ensure functionality in the "Level" package is updated to also work with puzzle data.

text.content: Setting up a Spline <> Platform combination example/prefab, in which the platform moves along the curve of the spline Ideally, the end result will be a prefab with a script(s) with inspector options to define the path. This prefab/object will conform to the Kinematic Controller's \`IMoverController\` interface, specifically the method \`public void UpdateMovement(out Vector3 goalPosition, out Quaternion goalRotation, float deltaTime)\` will drive the movement. This way when the player hops on the platform he (or she) will move along with it An example of interface inmplementation is in Baguettes/MovePlatform.cs Note: Part 2 will be @laprasdev 's responsibility, which will be to take this implementation and slot it into the PlatformLayoutSystem so we can have many objects follow splines and adopt the triggering settings

text.content: \### Battle Sequence: Jungle Monster Boss Designer discretion with behavior loop below is a proposed loop. There should be a discrete combat loop which the player can learn and improve upon. !\[boss\](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8445d911-13c9-4633-8db4-e0b9c1c396a8) Design Attack cycle and a second Final Mode when the Monster is one hit from death. Final Hit Mode: Faster movement, throws more rocks, introduce solar beam attack (boss cannot be harmed during this attack u just have to swing or jump away fast enough to escape. 3x3 Hit cycle \_Rock Throwing Solar Beam attack Shockwave?!\_ \*\*Attack Ideas: Solar Beam Vine Whip Razor Leaf Leech Seed Boom Bug Throw Shockwave on hitting ground\*\* \*add anti-camping either boom bug or m !\[Screenshot 2024-08-20 at 10 56 06 AM\](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9ac4cb43-5d7c-473e-a354-ef360dafe016) oving platforms Example Sequence: ### Phase 1: The Encounter - \*\*Introduction:\*\* The player falls into a grotto full of thick vines and tall trees. Pool at the bottom. The jungle monster hangs from the ceiling, gripping the vines with its muscular arms, its single eye glaring menacingly at the player. - \*\*Environment:\*\* The arena is multi-leveled, with platforms scattered around. Vines hang from above, which the player can use to swing between platforms. text.content: Haptics are sent to the player when an enemy is hit due to haptic setup in \`PlayerDamageReceivedState\`. How to test: Hit a crab with a projectile, controller will vibrate. Proposal: Set up a state property that will flag whether or not a non-player state machine calling the state should send haptics to the player. \*\*This is primarily an issue for haptic-enabled states that will be used by both the player and non-players (like \`PlayerDamageReceivedState\`)

text.content: Implement package for making Puzzle requests to Substratum

title.plain_text: Implement package for making Puzzle requests to Substratum

text.content: Create a new package for making requests to the Substratum service to perform CRUD operations on Puzzles. The package should include functionality for all the "puzzle" endpoints defined in the documentation here: https://staging.substratum.bloomstudio.gg/swagger/index.html That is: \`GET /puzzles\` - Return a list of all puzzles in the Bloom ecosystem \`POST /puzzles\` - Create a new puzzle \`GET /puzzles/{id}\` - Return a specific puzzle by its ID \`PATCH /puzzles/{id}\` - Delete an existing puzzle by its ID \`DELETE /puzzles/{id}\` - Update an existing puzzle by its ID If https://github.com/BloomGameStudio/BloomGameClient/issues/350 was completed first, ensure functionality in the "Level" package is updated to also work with puzzle data.

text.content: Setting up a Spline <> Platform combination example/prefab, in which the platform moves along the curve of the spline Ideally, the end result will be a prefab with a script(s) with inspector options to define the path. This prefab/object will conform to the Kinematic Controller's \`IMoverController\` interface, specifically the method \`public void UpdateMovement(out Vector3 goalPosition, out Quaternion goalRotation, float deltaTime)\` will drive the movement. This way when the player hops on the platform he (or she) will move along with it An example of interface inmplementation is in Baguettes/MovePlatform.cs Note: Part 2 will be @laprasdev 's responsibility, which will be to take this implementation and slot it into the PlatformLayoutSystem so we can have many objects follow splines and adopt the triggering settings

text.content: slight weirdness with that timeofday rtpc fix from last night - unsure if it's on my end or your end. when the scene loads - .5 (day) is the default value that loads but for some reason it auto defaults to (night) in wwise even though the .5 value is correct and day is active. this creates an issue where you have to toggle from day>night>day>night to get to night sounds in the game. not currently a problem but it will be!![Screenshot 2024-09-07 at 5 17 08 PM](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7893dfd7-0232-4d21-ace3-5dfbc5cd74e2)

text.content: crabs currently use 2 events for footsteps: running\_enemy\_LeftFoot running\_enemy\_RightFoot with the addition of boom bugs, i think this should be simplified and changed so that we can have unique footsteps per enemy type. each footstep will simply trigger the same event, rather than leftfoot/rightfoot. my recommendation is something like: enemy\_crab\_footstep enemy\_boombug\_footstep

text.content: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/20172682-c332-4d3e-b6ba-47931edcaefe spline jumps from one point to the other. i made 2 splines to test this - inner and outer (inner was mostly to test to see if there was any difference if the spline being connected had anything to do with the bug) - the the outer spline follows the edges of the platform and has the start/end points connected in the corner with the bush. - the inner spline is identical but 1sq/m smaller and the start/end points are not connected (although they are \*very\* close) the most important part is around :17 to the end. as you can see near the end of the video the player is closer to the one edge but the tracker is stuck on the other edge until it jumps to the new position. can test using: branch - jungle\_feline scene - Pizza\_Sandbox\_Jungle
